channel.title: Roger Cheng at LALS
channel.description: Recent content on Roger Cheng at LALS

item.title: Sunday 2025/12/28
item.description:
Objective#

Complete probationary membership requirements.

Notes#

I thought I would complete probationary requirements today but when I double checked records I found I double-counted conductor hours on 12/7. So instead of a few hours over, I’m actually a bit short. I made this mistake because I had been writing down name of the engineer of train I was conducting. This system broke down when Richard Ronne and Steve Rodstein traded off engineering Santa Fe Electric on 12/7. Which meant my “conductor for Richard” hours and “conductor for Steve” hours were actually the same hours. Lesson learned, note-keeping system will evolve!

item.title: Sunday 2025/12/21
item.description:
Notes#

Christmas themed day along with Carolwood (Disney) barn. We had Santa, we had Grinch!

Murphy brought Baofeng configuration equipment and set me up so I can use my own radio.

Met another Roger (Taguchi)

Shawn brought and ran a Roger Goldmann (of original livesteamlocomotives.com) designed 2-8-0 steam locomotive pulling public trains.

Boschan brought and ran a small steam locomotive that fit in the trunk of a Honda Civic, a reassuringly accessible size! Boschan works professionally in a heat exchanger fabrication company, and offered to answer questions about building boilers when I reach that point. The little locomotive is an articulated 2-4-4-2 modeled after the Columbia River Belt Line 7 a.k.a. Skookum

item.title: Saturday 2025/12/20
item.description:
Objective#

Stopped by for a bit of yardwork, make things more presentable for Disney weekend. It’s going to be a busy day.

Notes#

Don said I just missed Jay Leno and his Chrysler Turbine car by less than 15 minutes. That would have been awesome.

Activity Log#

  • 3.0 hours total

    • 3.0 facility (28 out of 18)
    • 0.0 conducting (13.75 out of 18)
    • 0.0 kitchen (3 out of 6)

  • 1:30PM - 4:30PM (3.0 facility)

item.title: Monday 2025/12/15
item.description:
Objective#

Member of Ron Nelson work crew finishing up Bagley wall project.

Notes#

Engineer the center cab (a.k.a. work train) for a bit under Ron supervision. My first time engineering a locomotive, exciting!

Activity Log#

  • 3.5 hours total

    • 3.5 facility (25 out of 18)
    • 0.0 conducting (13.75 out of 18)
    • 0.0 kitchen (3 out of 6)

  • 9:00AM - 12:30PM

    • Put horizontal wall logs behind new vertical posts.
    • Refill dirt behind wall.
    • Clean up work site.
    • Remove broken rail side billboard.
    • Drill holes for new vertical posts.
    • New posts in concrete.
    • Clean up work site.

item.title: Sunday 2025/12/14
item.description:
Notes#

Murphy instructs me to send text reminder about Baofeng configuration equipment next Saturday evening. Today my train engineer had an extra radio I could use.

Liz ran her Allen 2-6-0 Mogul steam locomotive around the track during public run hours. Guests were entertained.

Activity Log#

  • 7.0 hours total

    • 2.25 facility (21.5 out of 18)
    • 4.75 conducting (13.75 out of 18)
    • 0.00 kitchen (3 out of 6)

  • 8:30AM - 10:45AM (2.25 facility)

item.title: Sunday 2025/12/07
item.description:
Notes#

Whenever I’m ready to upgrade from my starter whistle, Richard Ronne recommends Acme Thunderer 58 or Titanic.

Liz fired up her Allen Models of Nevada 2-6-0 Mogul coal-burning(!) steam locomotive but unfortunately some misplaced rods meant she couldn’t run it. Liz was very friendly and answered questions as I watched her go through procedure to shut her engine back down for the night.

Liz loves the K-27 locomotive, specificially engine 463, and was very excited to hear I’m contemplating building Kozo Hiraoka’s K-27. Sounds like I’ll have an appreciative fan if I go make one a 463.

item.title: Saturday 2025/12/06
item.description:
Objective#

Ron Nelson’s Bagley Wall crew in the morning, then stayed around for additional independent facility work in the afternoon.

Notes#

Dorado tri-tip is very tasty

Activity Log#

  • 6.75 hours total

    • 6.75 facility (16.75 out of 18)
    • 0.0 conducting (4.5 out of 18)
    • 0.0 kitchen (3 out of 6)

  • 8:30AM - 11:45AM (3.25 facility)

    • Bagley wall disassembly
    • Set new vertical posts in concrete

  • 1:15PM - 2:45PM (1.5 facility)

    • Shovel sediment buildup out of waterwheel reservoir

  • 3:15PM - 5:15PM (2 facility)

item.title: Wednesday 2025/12/03
item.description:
Objective#

Was in the area and had a few hours to spare, stopped in for some facility work.

Met Rick and Russ(?) as they sorted through their inventory in the storage unit adjacent to elevated Gauge-1 layout. Rick’s got a Audi TDI with DR GROSS plate. Russ has a big truck and that’s not a tow hitch in the back: it’s a train coupler. Cool!

Activity Log#

  • 2.0 hours total

item.title: Sunday 2025/11/30
item.description:
Objective#

Work towards building conductor hours.

Notes#

Plan: After completing conductor training with Andrew Chavez, I came to see if I can get a few ride-alongs and maybe a check ride.

Actual: “You finished the class?” “Yeah.” “You passed the test?” “Yeah, 9/10.” “You’re conducting today.”

Normally I would talk to engineers to find out who needs a conductor, but today is different because of an unexpected shortage of conductors resulted in some shuffling and reassignment by safety coordinators.

item.title: Sunday 2025/11/23
item.description:
Objective#

Learn what happens during Sunday public ride operations.

Notes#

Listened to several conductors’ safety speeches.

One ride-along with Jim McCabe conducting.

I got to see the fabled Engine No. 8, club-owned steam locomotive. Tour by Anthony who just barely missed being able to run it when it broke down nearly a year ago.

Chatted with Eber and Nick Guzman about 3.5" gauge steam engines. I consider myself properly warned that smaller engines are more challenging to run smoothly due to smaller margins in maintaining proper level of fire and water.

item.title: Sunday 2025/11/09
item.description:
Objective#

Introduce myself to the Kountry Kitchen

Notes#

Johnny Dorado: “If you need hours, there is always something that needs doing around here.”

  • 3.0 hours total

    • 3.0 kitchen (3 out of 6)

  • 1:30PM - 4:30PM

    • Instructed on how to restock cold drinks.
    • Put instruction to practice.
    • Instructed on dish washing sink.
    • And put that to practice, too.

item.title: Saturday 2025/11/08
item.description:
Objective#

Welcome to the club, Roger! Now GET TO WORK!

Notes#

There was a crew removing a switch and track that went unused due to erosion from cliff, but they seemed to have enough people and Mike Finch thought I could be more useful elsewhere.

Activity Log#
